context: Hi tell me what kind of movies you like. I saw The Shape of Water (2017) it was great
I'm looking for a movie to make my boyfriend uncomfortable.
Oh then you gotta get The Other Woman (2014) It will have him squirming
What's the plot? Sounds like a movie for him!
gals get together for revenge on guy who played them all Lars and the Real Girl (2007) was good too. Super dorkey guy There's An Officer and a Gentleman if he's being a heel.
Haha. Sounds good. Is The Other Woman (2014) the grown up version of John Tucker Must Die (2006)
resp: I haven't seen John Tucker Must Die (2006) but I'll put it on my list!

context.content: Hi there! Do you have a preference for a specific genre or type of movie?
I'm into chilling, terrifying, and suspenseful horror movies, as well as intriguing mystery and thrilling suspenseful thrillers. Do you have any recommendations that cover these genres?
context.feelings: I love discovering hidden gems and underrated movies. It's always thrilling to uncover lesser-known films. I hope the recommender has some exciting recommendations for me.

context.content: Based on your preferences, I recommend "Psycho (1960)". It's a classic suspenseful thriller with chilling and terrifying elements that will keep you on the edge of your seat.
What's "Psycho (1960)" about? I'd love to know more about the storyline and if it has any intriguing mystery elements.
context.feelings: I'm intrigued by "Psycho (1960)" as it's a classic suspenseful thriller with chilling and terrifying elements. I wonder if it also has intriguing mystery elements. The recommender seems knowledgeable about classic movies, but I need to find out more about "Psycho (1960)" before deciding.

context.content: "Psycho (1960)" is a psychological horror thriller directed by Alfred Hitchcock. The story follows a secretary who embezzles money and goes on the run, eventually checking into a secluded motel run by a disturbed young man and his domineering mother. The film is filled with intriguing mystery elements and has a chilling and suspenseful atmosphere.

Wow, "Psycho (1960)" sounds really intriguing! I love the idea of a psychological horror thriller with chilling and suspenseful elements. The storyline with the secretary and the secluded motel sounds so mysterious. I think I'll accept this recommendation. [END]
context.feelings: I appreciate the recommender's suggestion of "Psycho (1960)" as it seems to have the chilling, terrifying, and suspenseful elements I enjoy. The intriguing mystery elements also make it even more appealing. The recommender has done a great job understanding my preferences. I think I'll accept this recommendation. [END]
